meanings.definition: In a manner befitting a master or teacher
meanings.sent1: She spoke magisterially, guiding her students with wisdom.
meanings.sent2: The professor explained the complex theory magisterially to the class.
meanings.sent3: The cat sat on the bookshelf, observing the room magisterially.
meanings.sent4: The old oak tree stood magisterially in the center of the garden.
meanings.sent5: The mountain peak rose magisterially above the clouds.

meanings.sent1: He issued orders magisterially, expecting immediate compliance.
meanings.sent2: The CEO addressed the employees magisterially during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel chattered magisterially as if it owned the park.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered magisterially, foretelling a heavy downpour.
meanings.sent5: The lion roared magisterially, asserting its dominance over the savannah.

meanings.definition: In a commanding or dignified manner
meanings.sent1: The queen entered the hall magisterially, drawing all eyes to her.

meanings.sent5: The ship sailed magisterially through the calm waters of the bay.
